values:
The Everything Test

There are many different types of tests on the internet today. Personality tests, purity tests, stereotype tests, political tests. But now, there is one test to rule them all.

Traditionally, online tests would ask certain questions about your musical tastes or clothing for a stereotype, your experiences for a purity test, or deep questions for a personality test.We're turning that upside down - all the questions affect all the results, and we've got some innovative results too! Enjoy :-)

Personality
You are more logical than emotional, more concerned about others than concerned about self, more religious than atheist, more loner than dependent, more lazy than workaholic, more traditional than rebel, more engineering mind than artistic mind, more cynical than idealist, more follower than leader, and more introverted than extroverted.

As for specific personality traits, you are romantic (71%), religious (60%).

Stereotypes
Prep100%
Young Professional50%
Punk Rock47%
  
Life Experience
Sex23%
Substances22%
Travel53%

Politics
Your political views would best be described as Conservative, whom you agree with around 57% of the time. 		  Socioeconomic
Your attitude toward life best associates you with Upper Class. You make more than 86% of those who have taken this test, and 4% more than the U.S. average.

If your life was a movie, it would be rated PG.
By the way, your hottness rank is 50%, hotter than 17% of other test takers.

TAKE THE TEST
brought to you by thatsurveysite
http://br0ken---smile.livejournal.com/6808.html

I haven't been on in a long time... for many reasons-- law school exams are sucking away most of my time, I've been sort of ill, and probably mostly---- I haven't been doing that well.  i've pretty much stopped losing, but at least I haven't really been gaining either.

But it's time to get back to the basics.  I never have actually gone off the program, but I stopped being so perfect about journaling, and I'm letting myself slip.  So before it gets too far, I need to re-commit!  And that also means doing a better job reading/commenting/updating in this journal!


xposted a few places
http://br0ken---smile.livejournal.com/6175.html

I've had this belt hanging in my closet for a few years... I don't even remember how I obtained it.  It's pink with green alligators, and really cute.  But it never fit, it wouldn't come close to wrapping all the way around my waist.  Yesterday, I was wearing a pink and green striped shirt and thought to myself "that alligator belt would look so cute, maybe I'll see if I'm anywhere near to being able to wear it yet..."  So I tried it on, and the belt fit!  Not only did it fit, it had like 2-3 inches to spare!  I was soooo pumped.

(x-posted)
http://br0ken---smile.livejournal.com/5985.html

Weekly Update:
I was sooooo worried all week because I'm a compulsive weigher, and it appeared that although I hadn't really cheated or done anything wrong, I had gained about 3 pounds this week... but when I woke up yesterday morning (my weigh-in day), somehow all that weight had disappeared and by the time I went to my weigh-in last night, I was actually down a pound from last week, so woo hoo!  Down to 233.5-- only 8.5 pounds left to go until I reach my birthday goal (april 6)!!!

Recipe Request:
I would like to eat more fish, but I live with my parents and right now all my mom cooks is frozen salmon in the oven--- she says she's willing to cook me anything I want, but she just doesn't know how to cook any other fish that isn't too expensive or too complex.  Sooooo if any of you have *simple* fish recipes, I would really appreciate it if you'd pass them along!!!!!!
http://br0ken---smile.livejournal.com/5635.html

I lost another 3 pounds this week! And that's even after being gone all weekend and not having a whole lot of control over where we stopped to eat and what kind of options I would have... so I am very excited! ******** SW: 276 pounds CW: 235 pounds TWL: 3 pounds Total: 41 pounds!! ******** So I earned another 5-pound gold start this week, yippee!! Only 10 pounds to go until my birthday goal... I hope I can keep on track :-) ticker for short-term goal: ticker for long term goal:
http://br0ken---smile.livejournal.com/5480.html

Well, the interview this morning went well I think.  It wasn't a completely horrible experience, so I guess that's a good thing!  I won't find out until the end of the month about if they want to hire me or not, they still have some more interviews to do, but we shall see!  

It's with a law firm, to be a clerk for the summer... however, apparently they want the person to start asap... so that kinda sucks because I don't want to be working at a firm *and* going to school, but if that's what it takes to get a job for the summer, I guess I'll have to be happy doing it.  

The new *size 18 regular* suit worked very well-- I felt great in it!  So hopefully they thought I looked great too!  

If I do get the job, I have to make sure that the added stress doesn't prevent me from getting my booty into the gym!
http://br0ken---smile.livejournal.com/5264.html

******* Start Weight: 276 pounds Current Weight: 238 pounds This Week's Loss: 2 pounds Total Loss: 38 pounds ******* Ticker for Short Term goal of 225 by April 6, 2006 Ticker for Long term goal of 149 by April 6, 2007 [x-posted to _weightwatchers]
http://br0ken---smile.livejournal.com/4868.html

So here's my non-scale victory of the week:

kinda long-winded, so I'll put it behind a cut

<lj-cut>

On Tuesday I said to myself, "well self, it looks like no one is going to come knocking on your door and offer you a job for the summer, so you better start applying for some on your own."  Sooooo, I found the addresses of 10 firms in my area that specialize in estate planning (because that's what I want to do) and sent off my cover letter and resume on Tuesday evening.  Well, Thursday the secretary from one of the firms called and set up an interview with me for this coming Thursday.  Well, this is great and all-- but I didn't really think people would respond to my random solicitations for employment, and had NOTHING to wear to said interview.

So today, I went into the little "downtown" area near my house to try to find some clothes.  There's a Talbot's Women's store that I figured would have a suit.... or at least there USED to be a Talbot's Women's store (up until a few days ago) but it is now closed.  So I went down the block to their regular store.... and low and behold, I fit into their size 18 suit!  Are you freaking kidding me?  I fit into clothing from a regular sized store, and it isn't like a stretchy t-shirt or sweater!  It's a SUIT!  Go me!!!  It made me want to walk around the store and buy everything they had to offer just because it would fit--- but I don't want to buy a lot at this size because it's not my ultimate goal, so paying $350 for a suit was enough money wasting for the day.  

</lj-cut>

Yeah, so I am elated to say the least!


x-posted to _weightwatchers
http://br0ken---smile.livejournal.com/4713.html

well, I finally figured out how to put pictures in here, so I figured I owe some progress shots. I don't really have a good "before" from my highest, but I'm including that is at about the time right before I started.... So here's the progression of losing 35 pounds so far... mostly I just see it in my face, but it's coming along-- I'll get there eventually! This one is about 275? Here is 260 250 And 240, where I am now I plan on taking them every 10 pounds... so this is just the start! x-posted a bit
http://br0ken---smile.livejournal.com/4549.html

1.  Graze Responsibly, or not at all
2.  Eat Aware
3.  Diffuse Emotional Eating
4.  Curb Cravings
5.  Hone in on Hunger
6.  Eat Slowly!
7.  Derail Deprivation


We talked about all these things at my meeting last night... totally makes sense... if you need a better explanation on what any of those seven things means, just ask!


*******
SW (Oct 26):  276
CW (Jan 31):  240.4
This week's loss:  3.8
Total Loss:  35.6!
*******

(x-posted to _weightwatchers)
http://br0ken---smile.livejournal.com/4122.html

Ok, so I took everyone's advice and did weights first today... I did 10 minutes on the treadmill to warm up, then 35 minutes lifting, then 45 minutes on the elliptical (3.35 miles, pyramid resistance)... and doing weights first certainly made some sort of change in the workout because by the end, I honestly thought I was either going to pass out or throw up (thankfully neither of the two actually happened)-- but in a good way, if that's even possible. Sooooo hopefully this new change to the workout will bring with it positive results!! Thanks for the recommendation :-)
http://br0ken---smile.livejournal.com/3928.html

So I was at the gym today, and when I got off the elliptical this woman (who was young and thin) came over to me and said "wow!  I can't belive your endurance on that thing!  How long were you on it?  I'm so jealous, I can't even make it to ten minutes!"

I never thought the day would arrive when someone in the gym was impressed by something I was able to do.  That just made me smile so much-- in fact, I am still smiling about it!!

So what if I was the fattest person in the room?  At least I'm taking positive steps to do something about it :-)

(x-posted to _weightwatchers)
http://br0ken---smile.livejournal.com/3710.html

And another successful week under my belt! I finished out my 12-week pre-paid membership... and signed up for another 16 so I got a lovely red tote bag. ****** SW (Oct 26, 2005): 276 CW (Jan 17, 2006): 243 This week's loss: 4 pounds! Total Loss so far: 33 pounds! ****** Ticker for short term goal-- for April '06 Ticker for long-term goal-- for April '07 Hope you're all doing well! (x-posted to _weightwatchers)
http://br0ken---smile.livejournal.com/3489.html

Here's a good non-scale victory for the day.... I have this beautiful gold dress that I bought about a year ago that was nowhere near to fitting, but it was soooo pretty, and on sale from $300 down to $70 and I just had to have it.  Today just for kicks I tried it on to see if I had gotten any closer to fitting into it---- and it zipped all the way up!  Now, it didn't look *good*, and I wouldn't wear it out in public yet, but I did fit into it, so I'm getting closer to the point when I can wear it!  Yay :-)

(x-posted)
http://br0ken---smile.livejournal.com/3155.html

Well, I come bearing exciting news this week!! I made it to my 10% goal-- and surpassed it by losing an extra two pounds this week beyond what I needed for the 10%! Yay for me, but boo for the receptionist who weighed me in because she forgot to write it down on the awards list, so it didn't get announced at the meeting... but not to worry, I went up to the desk after the meeting to claim my key chain :-) The more I lose, the more I want to lose. This program really does work. ***** Start Weight (Oct 26): 276 Today's Weight (Jan 10): 247 This week's loss: -3 Total Loss: -29 ***** Ticker for my next 10% goal, hoping to make it by April '06 Ticker for my ultimate goal of 149 by April '07 Here's to another great week for ALL of us!! (cross posted to _weightwatchers)
http://br0ken---smile.livejournal.com/2930.html

I went to the doctor today for her to check in on my weight.  I was there in October, and she's the one who told me I should think about joining weight watchers.  When she came into the room she was so excited that I had joined and was seeing great results.  She too lost a lot of weight on the program, so she was going on and on about it, it was great!  Before she left she gave me a hug and says she can't wait to see me again in April :-)
http://br0ken---smile.livejournal.com/2790.html

Well, I missed week 10 because I was in Jamaica for the week between Christmas and New Years, but here I am back in the U.S. and back on track. I was so worried about going to weigh in tonight because I had missed last week, so since my last weigh-in there was Christmas parties and a whole week of vacation including new years, so the potential for gain was pretty high, but the good news is that I lost a pound and a half, earning me my 25 pound magnet! The bad news is that I was still 1 pound shy of making it to my new years goal-- but one pound isn't SO bad, therefore I am overall pleased with myself. It was amazing how differently I behaved on vacation than the pre-Weight Watchers me would have behaved. In the whole week I was gone I only had two glasses of wine and no other alcohol--- and this was while staying at an all-inclusive resort with free booze! The old me would have had about 10 strawberry daquiris each day, but the new me is finding it easier and easier to say no to temptation. I'm not going to lie, I did use up and go over all my flex points, but it could have been waaaaaay worse. I was making much better decisions about what I put in my mouth than I ever have before, AND I made sure to journal everything, even the points that went over! Start Weight Oct 26, 2005: 276 Last Weigh In Dec. 20, 05: 251.5 Today's Weigh In Jan 3 06: 250 Total Loss: 26 Short Term goal of making my 10% by New Years (didn't quite make it) Next Short Term 10% goal of 225 by April 06 Long Term Goal of 149 by April 07 Happy New Year everyone! (x-posted to _weightwatchers)
http://br0ken---smile.livejournal.com/2458.html

My skinny beautiful perfect sister is home for Christmas. She now has me count her points every day for her just because she thinks it is a fun nightly activity. There's not much I wouldn't do to look like her.... but anyway, it is possible that my new years goal might possibly be attainable now because I lost FIVE pounds this week, so now I'm getting really close!!!! **** Starting Weight Oct. 26: 276 Current Weight: 251.5 This Week's Loss: 5.0 Total Loss So Far: 24.5 **** Ticker for new years goal of 10% Ticker for ultimate goal by 25th birthday (April '07) Let's hope I can keep this up through all the holiday parties AND my week long trip to Jamaica! My mom says there's no way I can lose weight on vacation, I need to prove her wrong! (x-posted to _weightwatchers)
http://br0ken---smile.livejournal.com/2302.html

Well here I am in the middle of law school finals, and what am I doing? Obsessing over being more healthy about food instead of studying like I know I should be, hahahahaha-- classic procrastination. The good news is that after last week's gain of 1 pound, I managed to come back this week and lose three, so it averages out to having lost one both weeks. The bad news is that I'm starting to think I might not be able to get to my 10% goal by new year's... but I haven't given up all hope, we shall see! *** Start Weight: 276 (Oct. 26) Current Weight: 256.5 Total Lost: 19.5 *** Short term 10% goal of 27 pounds by New Year's: Long term goal of 150 by my 25th birthday (April 2007): Just gotta hang in there!!!! (x-posted br0ken___smile & _weightwatchers)
http://br0ken---smile.livejournal.com/1958.html

Well, I just finished week 6, went to the meeting this morning instead of last night like I normally do because last night I had a final review session for a class.  The dissapointment set in when I stepped on the scale and had gained a pound.... might be because I was wearing shoes (since I didn't have socks on I couldn't take them off)... might be because I'm retaining water... might be because I only ate 14 points yesterday and my body went into starvation mode... might be a lot of things, but I don't want to make excuses-- I gained the pound, and now it's time to loose it and make up for it at next week's weigh-in.  I know it is just a pound and it could have been a lot worse, so I'm not going to let this destroy me--- it just needs to be a wake-up call!!

***
Start Weight: 276
Current Weight: 259.5
Total Loss: 16.5
Pounds until 10%:  10.5
***


Hope the scales are being more friendly to you than they are to me!
http://br0ken---smile.livejournal.com/1770.html

So I've been doing weight watchers for six weeks now, and today I came across my first major non-scale victory :-)

My parents and I are taking SCUBA diving classes, which require us to wear a lot of crazy equipment.  One of the pieces is a buoyancy control device, which is like a vest that you wear that can blow up with air to help you float... well, the best thing ever happened today when I put mine on, I could get the velcro that goes around my stomach to go about two or three inches farther than I could when we started these classes!  Hooray!

I'm refusing to invest in a wetsuit until my thin body comes out-- no need to buy one that will fit me at this stage of the game, this body will be leaving us and a new one will be here eventually at the end of the weight loss journey!!!

Hope you're all having positive days :-)
http://br0ken---smile.livejournal.com/1460.html

Well I made it through Thanksgiving successfully-- Yahoooo! I was sure I was going to see a gain on that scale last night when I went to the meeting, so I convinced myself I'd be happy with maintainging-- however, I managed to lose two more pounds!!! What an amazing program-- it really works when you do what you're told to do :-) *** Start Weight: 276 Current Weight: 258 this week's loss: 2 Total Loss: 18 *** Ticker for my first 10% goal by New Years: Ticker for my ultimate goal of 150 by April '07 Good luck making it through these next few weeks of temptations!
http://br0ken---smile.livejournal.com/1175.html

Hey Everyone! Just wanted to drop in a quick update... I had my weigh-in last night marking my first month with the program and we discussed how to get through thanksgiving without totally ruining everything we've worked for, so I feel like tomorrow will be fine. The main thing that I'm worried about is that my parents are planning a SCUBA-diving trip to Jamaica for us to go on between Christmas and New Years at an all-inclusive place that gives you FREE DRINKS all day. I could live off of yummy fruity drinks, but I know they're hella bad. Guess we'll cross that bridge when we get there... *** Start Weight: 276 Current Weight: 260 Loss this week: 2 Total Loss: 16 *** Ticker for my short term goal of 10% by New Year's: and.... Ticker for the ultimate goal of 150 by age 25: Happy Thanksgiving!
http://br0ken---smile.livejournal.com/822.html

I have found a great way to stop myself from unnecessary snacking-- any time I feel like putting something in my mouth, I brush my teeth instead! I hate eating right after I brush because then I lose the "so fresh and so clean" feeling inside my mouth. It's a quick fix, and great for the dental health too!! Ticker for my 10% Goal (hope to make it by New Years): Ticker for my Ultimate Goal (hope to make it by my 25th Birthday-- April '07):
http://br0ken---smile.livejournal.com/765.html

A few random thoughts:

1. So I have finally gotten really good about drinking tons and tons of water every day-- but the only problem is that two days a week I am an intern for a federal judge... so having to go to the bathroom really badly in the middle of a hearing is never a comfortable thing!

2. Lately I've been finding myself getting to the end of the day with points leftover-- mainly because I have breakfast, then pack a lunch then am not home until dinner time so I don't have a chance to snack or anything-- and if I'm just eating what I pack for lunch in the morning, there's not much room for error. I know I'm SUPPOSED to eat all my points each day so my body doesn't think I'm starving it--- but I always feel like it's so counter-productive to mow down on food in the evening just to finish up some leftover daily points.

3. I went and got my hair trimmed yesterday and my hair dresser told me that I was looking thinner to her! I mean, it's kinda their job to try to butter up the customers so we keep coming back-- but there must have been *some* basis for her to think to mention it!!

Okay, those are enough random ramblings for the time being.... Hope this week is going well for everyone!!!
http://br0ken---smile.livejournal.com/303.html
